## Private Member Functions

### extractModifierFromExpr() {#af01962ed91d329e1cacb4c5339179952}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MCExpr &#42; PPCAsmParser::extractModifierFromExpr (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; E, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcmcexpr/#a1ec88096dadbb5dc95ee1d2beb8f43ae">PPCMCExpr::VariantKind</a> &amp; Variant)</>}>
Extract.

<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">@<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea2db95e8e1a9267b7a1188556b2013b33">l</a>/@ha </Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 modifier from expression. Recursively scan the expression and check for VK&#95;PPC&#95;LO/HI/HA symbol variants. If all symbols with modifier use the same variant, return the corresponding <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcmcexpr/#a1ec88096dadbb5dc95ee1d2beb8f43ae">PPCMCExpr::VariantKind</a>, and a modified expression using the default symbol variant. Otherwise, return NULL.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp/#l00112">112</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp">PPCAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### fixupVariantKind() {#a633a16a1a6339e98c22828f014bcd2d1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MCExpr &#42; PPCAsmParser::fixupVariantKind (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; E)</>}>
Find all VK&#95;TLSGD/VK&#95;TLSLD symbol references in expression and replace them by VK&#95;PPC&#95;TLSGD/VK&#95;PPC&#95;TLSLD.

This is necessary to avoid having <em>GLOBAL&#95;OFFSET&#95;TABLE</em> created via ELFObjectWriter::RelocNeedsGOT. FIXME: This is a hack.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp/#l00114">114</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp">PPCAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### matchAndEmitInstruction() {#a56069b4441b91006c71e7b2394747611}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool PPCAsmParser::matchAndEmitInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> IDLoc, unsigned &amp; Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61e27c75c3334cffa54c44c02077da1e">OperandVector</a> &amp; Operands, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a> &amp; Out, uint64&#95;t &amp; ErrorInfo, bool MatchingInlineAsm)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Recognize a series of operands of a parsed instruction as an actual MCInst and emit it to the specified MCStreamer.

This returns false on success and returns true on failure to match.

On failure, the target parser is responsible for emitting a diagnostic explaining the match failure.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp/#l00126">126</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp">PPCAsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### tryParseRegister() {#ae35f540eead972b2ab328ab9242ee0c9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ParseStatus PPCAsmParser::tryParseRegister (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregister">MCRegister</a> &amp; Reg, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> &amp; StartLoc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> &amp; EndLoc)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
tryParseRegister - parse one register if possible

Check whether a register specification can be parsed at the current location, without failing the entire parse if it can&#39;t. Must not consume tokens if the parse fails.

### validateTargetOperandClass {#ad8dd7af94a4ebc080910c6f8578eb848}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned PPCAsmParser::validateTargetOperandClass (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcparsedasmoperand">MCParsedAsmOperand</a> &amp; Op, unsigned Kind)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Allow a target to add special case operand matching for things that tblgen doesn&#39;t/can&#39;t handle effectively.

For example, literal immediates on ARM. TableGen expects a token operand, but the parser will recognize them as immediates.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp/#l00156">156</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/lib/target/powerpc/asmparser/ppcasmparser-cpp">PPCAsmParser.cpp</a>.
